data.title: A Darkness History Tim Burton Life
data.meta_description: A Darkness History Tim Burton Life - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. A darknes history. “The life of Tim Burton” Francisco Rafael González Chávez Sumer Course Int. 1

2. Birthday • He was born in Burbank, California. • In Agust 25th, on 1958.

4. • Tim Burton described his childhood self as quirky, self-absorbed and highly imaginative.

6. Working whit Disney! • After high school, he won a Disney scholarship to attend the California Institute of the Arts in Valencia, California.

9. Vincent •His first Short, with a duration of 5.52min. This was based in a short poem written by Burton. 1982

11. Frankenweenie • It´s a parody of (and homage to) the 1931 film Frankensteinbased on Mary Shelley's book of the same name. 1984

14. Pee-wee´s Big Adventure •Paul Reubenssaw Frankenweenie, he chose Burton to direct the cinematic spin-off of his popular character Pee-wee Herman 1985

16. • Burton, a fan of the eccentric musical group Oingo Boingo, asked songwriter Danny Elfman to provide the music for the film.

18. Beetlejuice • A supernatural comedy horror about a young couple forced to cope with life after death, as well as a family of pretentious yuppies invading their treasured New England home. 1988

20. Batman • Burton claimed that “The Killing Joke” was a major influence on his film adaptation of Batman. 1989

22. The 90´s...

23. Edward Scissorhands • Edward looked human, but was left with scissors in the place of hands due to the untimely death of his creator. 1990

25. Batman Returns •Darkerand considerably more personal than its predecessor, concerns were raised that the film was too scary for children. Catwoman, penguin and Max Shreck. 1992

27. The Nightmare Before Christmas 1993

30. Ed Wood

32. Mars Attacks! •Based on a popular science fiction trading card series, the film was a hybrid of 1950s sci-fi flicks and 1970s all-star disaster flicks—this was a clever satire and goofy mayhem!

34. •Burton paid homage to the old horror movies from English company Hammer Film Productions.

36. Tim Burton´s Lost in Oz. •Conceived as an original TV series based on the works of “L. Frank Baum”, this was never aired!

41. • Planet of the Apes was a commercial success, grossing $68 million in its opening weekend. The film was a significant departure from Burton's usual style

43. • During the making of the film, Burton met actress Helena Bonham Carter, who would later become his partner.

44. • The film is about a father telling the story of his life to his son using exaggeration and color.

46. Charlie and the Chocolate Factory • Is an adaptation of the book by Roald Dahl. The film generally took a more faithful approach to the source material than the 1971 adaptation.

48. Corpse Bride • Was Burton's second stop-motion film. Burton was able to again use his familiar styles and trademarks, such as the complex interaction between light and darkness, and of being caught between two irreconcilable worlds.

51. Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street • Adaptation of Stephen Sondheim and Hugh Wheeler's 1979 musical thriller. It re- tells the Victorian melodramatic tale of Sweeney Todd, an English barber who murders his customers with a straight razor and, with the help of his accomplice, Mrs. Lovett, turns their remains into meat pies.

54. Future Projects

55. • The story follows 9, a sapient rag doll who joins and helps lead a group of his own kind to protect humanity's fallen legacy on Earth from machines that roam the planet.

62. • Muchas de las cosas que ves cuando eres niño permanecen contigo ... Pasas la mayor parte de tu vida intentando asimilar esas experiencias. Tim Burton, My Art and Films[
